collection.name: Moving 2D content to a 3D world
collection.description:
The VR/AR web seems to be the latest buzz word in the web community.\n\n At I/O 2016 Google made several big announcements about the technology... Older products and frameworks are still going strong but the competition keeps getting stronger all the time

The most interesting metaphor is how we read online... this goes beyond Nielsen's people only scan online content but tries to answer a more fundamental question of building initerfaces and new metaphors for reading content online. \n\n Multi platform support is the sticking point for development. \n\n None of the big desktop vendors support Mac as a platform for either development or playback. Trying to figure out how much of a sore subject this will become moving forward. None of the major HMD support the Mac as a platform so we can't test those devices for that platform... how do we ensure that our solution displays properly on those devices?  

See Josh Carpenter's [SFHTML5 Presentation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZOaOYTOpwyM) on VR UX/UI from 2015 to provide a contrast to where we are now.  

Possible deliverables may include:  

* Selection of tools and technologies to accomplish the task
* Ideas for how to dusplay 2D content in a 3D environment 
* Code to accomplish this display

collection.name: athena-document
collection.description:
As part of the Athena project, create a markdown document viewer styles with the same options that I want to use for the rest of the project. 

It uses [juicy-markdown](https://github.com/Juicy/juicy-markdown/) for parsing Github Flavored Markdown. It should work with all the GH extensions to Markdown

It uses [Robot Draft](http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Roboto+Condensed) for text and headings and [Source Code Pro](http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Source+Code+Pro) for code blocks
